message_1:
Let's say the domain of discourse is the set of natural numbers. Define a second-order predicate P as follows:

P(x) = "x is a prime number"

Write a higher-order logic expression that expresses the statement "there exists a function F that maps an arbitrary natural number n to a prime number greater than n". 

In other words, find a higher-order logic expression that asserts the existence of a function F such that for any natural number n, F(n) is a prime number that is greater than n.
